title.narrative: CAREGIVERS/PARENTS ENSURE MORE CHILDRENIN SCHOOLS AND ECD/EARLY LEARNING CENTRES

description.narrative: Mothers, fathers and caregivers in selected provinces have improved understanding of the value of sending girls and boys, including children with disabilities, to school, including to early childhood education centres., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, school aged girls and boy, especially the most marginalized, successfully complete pre-primary and primary education.

sector.narrative: Provision of (formal and non-formal) early-learning / pre-primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of early learning / pre-primary education teacher training
Provision of parental education for school readiness (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of training of school communities e.g. parent teacher associations, school management committees

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Mothers, fathers and caregivers in selected provinces have improved understanding of the value of sending girls and boys, including children with disabilities, to school, including to early childhood education centres.

description.narrative: Demand for access to quality education was enhanced for 20,650 children (Girls: 9,912) through the capacity building of 140 inclusive early childhood development centre as well as 29 elementary and 29 primary school boards of management members. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of schools where the school BoM has received training on developing equity based School Learning Improvement Plans
School stakeholders (BoM, PNC, staff and students) identify and take action to prevent SRGBV and promote a safe school environment
ECE Committees are formed and operationalized in each centres (involving parents and local communities).
Service Delivery - Early learning - ECD centres benefiting from UNICEF interventions
System Strengthening - Skills - Community engagement support the mainstreaming of skills development within the national system - score (1-4), see guidance
